nodes.description: Gunmen attacked worshippers from a minority sect in two worship places in Lahore on Friday, killing over 80 people.
Three attackers blew themselves up with suicide vests when police tried to enter the building in Garhi Shahu, resulting in a higher death toll there.
One attacker was arrested in Model Town, and another was killed, with the arrested attacker being a teenage Pashtun linked to Waziristan and possibly the Taliban.
A suicide vest laden with explosives was recovered from Model Town, where some attackers escaped and fired at a television van.
Stock market investors shrugged off the violence, with the Karachi Stock Exchange benchmark index up 0.75 percent.
